1.text: And concerning sacrifice to idols, we know, (for we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffs up, and love builds the house.

2.text: And if any one thinks to know anything, as yet he has known nothing as he ought to know.

3.text: And if any one love God, the same is known of him.)

4.text: Concerning food therefore of sacrifices to idols, we know that an idol nothing in the world, and that none other God but one.

5.text: For also though they are called gods, whether in heaven, whether upon the earth, (for there are many gods, and many lords,)

6.text: But to us one God, the Father, of whom all things, and we for him; and one Lord Jesus Christ, by whom all things, and we by him.

7.text: But not in all, knowledge: and some with consciousness of the idol even till now eat as a sacrifice to idols: and their consciousness being weak is contaminated.

8.text: And food sets us not before God: for neither, if we eat, do we abound; neither if we eat not, do we want.

9.text: And see ye lest this your power be a stumble to the weak.

10.text: For if any one see thee having knowledge reclining in the idolâ€™s temple, shall not his consciousness, being weak, be built up to eat the sacrifices to idols;

11.text: And shall the weak brother be destroyed upon thy knowledge, for whom Christ died?

12.text: And so sinning against the brethren, and striking their weak consciousness, ye sin against Christ.

13.text: Wherefore, if food offend my brother, I will eat no flesh forever, lest I shall offend my brother.
